videos.video_name: Advanced Combo Sequences 11-20 with Integrated Muay Thai Techniques
strategies: Expanding the fighter's striking repertoire with advanced boxing combinations that incorporate Muay Thai techniques for a more versatile offense.
Building sequences that start with boxing combinations and end with Muay Thai weapons, allowing for creative and effective striking flows.
Introducing variability in attacks to confuse opponents and create openings for significant strikes.

techniques.description: A boxing sequence of jab, cross, jab, followed by a Muay Thai kick (leg, body, or head) to capitalize on the created openings.

techniques.variation: Cross, Jab, Cross with Opposite Kick
techniques.description: This combination reverses the traditional jab, cross pattern and includes an opposite leg kick to exploit defensive gaps.

strategies: Utilizing diagonal and upward elbows to penetrate the opponent's guard.
Employing elbows to clear the guard and create openings for further strikes.
Focusing on the angle and execution to maximize the cutting potential of elbows, leading to fight-ending injuries.

techniques.description: A sharp, angled strike designed to penetrate or bypass the guard and target the head or body.
Delivered from the rear hand, this elbow comes at a diagonal angle, ideal for creating cuts or breaking through defenses.

strategies: Facilitates memorization and quick recall during training and combat.
Allows for the integration of feints within combinations.
Enables the creation of fluid combinations using a mix of strikes.

techniques.description: A quick, straight punch thrown with the lead hand, foundational for combinations.
A powerful, straight punch delivered with the rear hand, often follows a jab.

strategies: Utilizing teeps for range control and to maintain distance from the opponent.
Incorporating feints and switch movements to disguise the true intention of the teep, creating openings for further attacks.
Seamlessly integrating teeps into combinations, using them to set up high-impact strikes or to disrupt the opponent's offense.

techniques.description: A direct front kick from the lead leg, used for quick jabs to the opponent's midsection or lower body to maintain or create distance.
Delivered from the back leg, offering more power and used to push the opponent back or off-balance them.
